availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Orlean B. McCulley (Hopkins County, KY, farmer, corporal 10th ky cav (csa))

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Isaac McCulley and Rebecca McCulley. Resident of Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Admitted into the Taylor Academy at Kentucky University in Harrodsburg in 1859. Farm laborer in Hopkins County in 1860. Served in the 10th Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a corporal from August 13, 1862 to 1865. Listed as a prisoner of war at Camp Douglass, Illinois, on March 6, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 165A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 820.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0058.
Selected Records of the War Department Relating to Confederate Prisoners of War, 1861-1865, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M598, p. 153.
First Annual Announcement of Kentucky University, 1859, (Louisville, KY: Morton & Griswold, Printers, 1859), 32.
